description: Position of start of first occurrence of prime(n) after the decimal point in expansion of Pi.
example: Pi = 3.14159265358979323846264338327950288... (see A000796).First occurrence of prime(23) = 83 starts at the 26th digit after the decimal point, hence a(23) = 26.
prog: (MAGMA) k:=3500; R := RealField(k); [ Position(IntegerToString(Round(10^k*(-3 + Pi(R)))), IntegerToString(NthPrime(n))) : n in [1..55] ]; /* Klaus Brockhaus, Feb 15 2007 */
author: _Patrick De Geest_, Jan 04 1999.
